buffer to strore message in

Counter for the outgoing frames.
Absolute sample counter when the tags have been updated the last time.
Absolute sample counter when the rx_time was seen last time.
Buffer to store received stream tags that are copied into the frame.

Aligned buffer of one float for ASM checking.
Counter for debugging.
Index of the input stream that the AR is locked in. If in search state, this variable may contain anything.
Bit index of the next expected ASM in the byte indicated by d_offset_byte if in lock state. If in search state this variable may contain anything.
Number of bits the first sample that belong to a old byte which's samples have already been consumed.

memberdef.name: ccsds_make_mpsk_ambiguity_resolver_f

briefdescription.para: Return a shared_ptr to a new instance of ccsds_mpsk_ambiguity_resolver_f.

detaileddescription.para: Create an instance of ccsds_mpsk_ambiguity_resolver_f and return it's shared_ptr.

parameterdescription.para: Modulation order. Determins how many parallel streams to watch.

String containing the attached sync marker to look for in hexadecimal representation. If asm_len is not a multiple of 8 (i.e. ASM is not a multiple of bytes), the ASM string should be tailed by zeros.
Length of the ASM in bits
Number of ASM losses to enter full search again. If set to one, a full search is performed every time an ASM is lost.
Minimum normalized correlation between an incomming bit sequence and the ASM to consider them matching.
Length of a frame (without ASM) in bytes.
Number of bits after the Frame that should be copied as well. Default is zero, so only the frame data is copied.

simplesect.para: Shared pointer to the created AR block

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned int M, std::string ASM, const unsigned int asm_len, const unsigned int threshold, const float correlation_threshold, const unsigned int frame_length, const unsigned int num_tail_syms=0)
memberdef.name: ccsds_mpsk_ambiguity_resolver_f

briefdescription.para: Private constructor of the AR.

detaileddescription.para:
M
Modulation order. Determins how many parallel streams to watch.
ASM
String containing the attached sync marker to look for in hexadecimal representation. Must be of even length.
asm_len
Length of the ASM in bits
threshold
Number of ASM losses to enter full search again. If set to one, a full search is performed every time an ASM is lost.
correlation_threshold
Minimum normalized correlation between an incomming bit sequence and the ASM to consider them matching.
num_tail_syms
Number of bits after the Frame that should be copied as well. Default is zero, so only the frame data is copied.
frame_length
Length of a frame (without ASM) in bytes.
Constructs a AR block that searches for the ASM in the M input streams and outputs the one that contains the ASM. If no ASM is found, no output is given. This block preserves the ASM, as it is still needed for frame synchronization after decoding.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of unpacked symbols (as float) that relate to the given number of packed bytes.

parameterdescription.para: Number of packed bytes.

simplesect.para: Number of unpacked bytes (symbols) that relate to packed.

briefdescription.para: Ensures that d_offset_bits is confined within [0,d_ldM). If not d_offset_bytes is increased accordingly.

memberdef.name: convert_ambiguity

briefdescription.para: Change ambiguity of incomming symbol stream.

parameterdescription.para: Symbol array where to put the new ambiguity in. Memory for at least num elements must be allocated.
Symbol array which's abmiguity is to be changed. Must contain at least num elements.
Number of elements (single bits) that should be converted. Must be a multiple of d_ldM, otherwise the last bits will be ignored.
Ambiguity that should be calculated. Must be in the range of [0,d_M), where 0 will just copy num elements from in to out.

briefdescription.para: Return the correlation between the input sequence and the ASM.

memberdef.name: search_for_ASM

briefdescription.para: Search for ASM in input sequence and return maximum found correlation.

detaileddescription.para: The search checks all possible offsets in the range of [0, num_in-d_ASM_LEN_BITS] starting from zero and abborts if a correlation of 1.0f is reached, or all offsets have been tried.

parameterdescription.para: Array of num_in input softbits. Must contain at least offset+d_ASM_LEN_BITS elements.
Number of elements in in. Must be at lease d_ASM_LEN_BITS
Pointer to an unsigned int where the offset of the found maximum correlation is stored.

briefdescription.para: Converts an array of d_ldM softbits into a byte of d_ldM hardbits.

parameterdescription.para: Array of floats. Must contain at least d_ldM elements.

simplesect.para: Byte containing the converted hardbits in the d_ldM least significant bit positions.

briefdescription.para: Scan all stream tags in scope and copy them into d_tag_buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Scan for all tags after max(d_tag_lastupdated, this->nitems_read(0)) and before until.

parameterdescription.para: Absolute sample count where to stop searching. This value is not included into the search anymore.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint64_t from, const unsigned int len)
memberdef.name: extractTags

briefdescription.para: Reads all tags from the buffer and creates a frame metadata header out of it.

detaileddescription.para: Calculates the reception time of the sample with the absolute count from based on the tag rx_time. Otherwise ignore the rx_time tag and label the calculated reception time rx_time in the created metadata.
Copies all other tags into the header.

parameterdescription.para: Absolute sample count for which the reception time should be calculated.
Length of the frame. Consider all tags up to from + len.

simplesect.para: PMT dictionary containing the extracted metadata. Keys are PMT symbols (strings), values are of generic type PMT and are copied from the Tags.

briefdescription.para: Public deconstructor of the AR.
M-PSK soft bit ambiguity resolution and frame synchronization.

detaileddescription.para: The input to this block is a stream of d_ldM grouped soft bits. The output of this block is a asynchronous message containing a float vector with the soft bits of a frame. The bytes passed to this block as ASM are cut off, but any skipped bits will be in the output message.

So if you pass the two ASM bytes 0x00 0xAA to this block followed by two bytes frame data (FD1 and FD2), followed by another two bytes ASM and set asm_skip_first_bits to zero the output will be a message containing FD1 and FD2. If asm_skip_first_bits is set to two, the output will be FD1, FD2 followed by the first two zero bits from the ASM.
Using asm_skip_first_bits (setting it to nonzero values)

The block will start in searchmode, looking for every possible bit offset in all possible M ambiguities. Once an ASM is found it will enter locked state where it will only check for the ASM at the expected position and ambiguity. If the ASM is found a counter is increased up to d_THRESHOLD. If an exprected ASM is not found the counter is decreased. If the counter reaches zero the block goes into search mode again.
